 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;sup&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;Wholly-owned&#13;subsidiary through October 10, 2017, the date of BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO, following which it is consolidated as a variable interest entity.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;has determined that BRAC, following its IPO, is a variable interest entity (&amp;#8220;VIE&amp;#8221;) and that the Company is the primary&#13;beneficiary of the VIE. The Company determined that, due to the redemption feature associated with the IPO shares, that the IPO&#13;shareholders are indirectly protected from the operating expenses of BRAC and it has the power to direct the activities of BRAC&#13;through the date at which BRAC affords the stockholders the opportunity to vote to approve a proposed business combination. Therefore,&#13;these consolidated financial statements herein contain the operations of the BRAC from its inception on May 9, 2017. BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;IPO shareholders are reflected in our Consolidated Financial Statements as a non-controlling interest. The non-controlling interest&#13;was recorded at fair value on October 10, 2017, with an addition on October 18, 2017 as a result of the underwriters&amp;#8217; exercise&#13;of their over-allotment option. All significant inter-company transactions have been eliminated in the preparation of theses financial&#13;statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The parent&#13;company, Black Ridge Oil &amp;#38; Gas, Inc. and Black Ridge Acquisition Corp. will be collectively referred to herein as the &amp;#8220;Company&amp;#8221;&#13;or &amp;#8220;Black Ridge&amp;#8221;. The Company&amp;#8217;s headquarters is in Minneapolis, Minnesota and substantially all of its operations&#13;are in the United States.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Reclassifications&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;As discussed&#13;in Note 4- Debt Restructuring, income, expense and cash flows from the restructured operations for the year ended December 31,&#13;2016 have been reclassified as net loss and cash flows from discontinued operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Segment&#13;Reporting&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;FASB ASC&#13;280-10-50 requires annual and interim reporting for an enterprise&amp;#8217;s operating segments and related disclosures about its&#13;products, services, geographic areas and major customers. An operating segment is defined as a component of an enterprise that&#13;engages in business activities from which it may earn revenues and expenses, and about which separate financial information is&#13;regularly evaluated by the chief operating decision maker in deciding how to allocate resources. The Company operates as a single&#13;segment and will evaluate additional segment disclosure requirements as it expands its operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Use&#13;of Estimates&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The preparation&#13;of financial statements in conformity with generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and&#13;assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at&#13;the date of the financial statements and the reported amount of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results&#13;could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Environmental&#13;Liabilities&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The oil and&#13;gas industry is subject, by its nature, to environmental hazards and clean-up costs. At this time, management knows of no substantial&#13;losses from environmental accidents or events which would have a material effect on the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Cash equivalents&#13;include money market accounts which have maturities of three months or less. For the purpose of the statements of cash flows,&#13;all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less are considered to be cash equivalents. Cash equivalents&#13;are stated at cost plus accrued interest, which approximates market value. The Company had no cash equivalents on hand as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017&#13;and December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2016.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Restricted&#13;cash and securities held in Trust Account&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; color: black&gt;As&#13;of December 31, 2017, $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;39,742 &lt;font style=color: black&gt;of cash and $138,940,611 of marketable&#13;securities were held in the Trust Account which is restricted for the benefit of the BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO shareholders to be available&#13;for those shareholders in the event they elect to redeem their shares following an approved business combination or the upon dissolution&#13;of BRAC.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash in Excess of FDIC Insured&#13;Limits&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;maintains its cash in bank deposit accounts which, at times, may exceed federally insured limits. Accounts are guaranteed by the&#13;Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) up to $250,000 under current regulations. The Company had approximately $977,089&#13;and $-0- in excess of FDIC insured limits at December 31, 2017 and 2016, respectively. &lt;font style=color: black&gt;As of December&#13;31, 2017, the Company had not experienced losses on these accounts and management believes the Company is not exposed to significant&#13;risks on such accounts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Debt&#13;Issuance Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Costs relating&#13;to obtaining certain debts are capitalized and amortized over the term of the related debt using the straight-line method, which&#13;approximates the effective interest method. The Company paid $4,400 and $-0- of debt issuance costs during the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017&#13;and&amp;#160;2016, respectively, of which the unamortized balance of debt issuance costs at December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and&amp;#160;2016&#13;was $-0- and $-0-, respectively. Amortization of debt issuance costs charged to interest expense was $4,400 and $-0- for the years&#13;ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and&amp;#160;2016, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Website Development Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;accounts for website development costs in accordance with ASC 350-50, &amp;#8220;Accounting for Website Development Costs&amp;#8221; (&amp;#8220;ASC&#13;350-50&amp;#8221;), wherein website development costs are segregated into three activities:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.5in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Initial&#13;                                         stage (planning), whereby the related costs are expensed.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.5in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Development&#13;                                         (web application, infrastructure, graphics), whereby the related costs are capitalized&#13;                                         and amortized once the website is ready for use. Costs for development content of the&#13;                                         website may be expensed or capitalized depending on the circumstances of the expenditures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.5in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Post-implementation&#13;                                         (after site is up and running: security, training, admin), whereby the related costs&#13;                                         are expensed as incurred. Upgrades are usually expensed, unless they add additional functionality.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;We have capitalized&#13;a total of $56,660 of website development costs from inception through December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2016. We have recognized depreciation&#13;expense on these website costs of $-0- and $-0- for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and&amp;#160;2016, respectively. As&#13;of December 31, 2017, all website development costs have been fully depreciated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities based on differences between the financial reporting and tax basis of assets and&#13;liabilities using the enacted tax rates and laws that are expected to be in effect when the differences are expected to be recovered.&#13;The Company provides a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets for which it does not consider realization of such assets to&#13;be more likely than not.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;On December&#13;22, 2017 the U.S. Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of 2017 (&amp;#8220;Tax Reform&amp;#8221;) was signed into law. As a result of Tax Reform, the&#13;U.S. statutory rate was lowered from 35% to 21% effective January 1, 2018, among other changes. ASC Topic 740 requires companies&#13;to recognize the effect of tax law changes in the period of enactment; therefore, the Company was required to value its deferred&#13;tax assets and liabilities at December 31, 2017 at the new rate. The SEC issued Staff Accounting Bulletin No. 118 (&amp;#8220;SAB&#13;108&amp;#8221;) to address the application of GAAP in situations when a registrant does not have the necessary information available,&#13;prepared or analyzed (including computations) in reasonable detail to complete the accounting for certain effects of Tax Reform.&#13;The ultimate impact may differ from the provisional amount, possibly materially, as a result of additional analysis, changes in&#13;interpretations and assumptions the Company has made, additional regulatory guidance that may be issued and actions the Company&#13;may take as a result of Tax Reform.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair Value&#13;of Financial Instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Under FASB&#13;ASC 820-10-05, the Financial Accounting Standards Board establishes a framework for measuring fair value in generally accepted&#13;accounting principles and expands disclosures about fair value measurements. This Statement reaffirms that fair value is the relevant&#13;measurement attribute. The adoption of this standard did not have a material effect on the Company&amp;#8217;s financial statements&#13;as reflected herein. The carrying amounts of cash, accounts payable and accrued expenses reported on the balance sheets are estimated&#13;by management to approximate fair value primarily due to the short term nature of the instruments. &lt;font style=color: black&gt;The&#13;Company had no items that required fair value measurement on a recurring basis.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Property&#13;and equipment are recorded at cost and depreciated using the straight-line method over their estimated useful lives of three to&#13;seven years. Expenditures for replacements, renewals, and betterments are capitalized. Maintenance and repairs are charged to&#13;operations as incurred. Long-lived assets are evaluated for impairment to determine if current circumstances and market conditions&#13;indicate the carrying amount may not be recoverable. The Company has not recognized any impairment losses on long-lived assets&#13;related to continuing operations. Depreciation expense was $10,848 and $14,271 for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017&#13;and&amp;#160;2016, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Concentration&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;All of the&#13;Company&amp;#8217;s revenue earned from continuing operations comes from management fees earned through its management services agreement&#13;with Black Ridge Holding Company, LLC (&amp;#8220;BRHC&amp;#8221;). Revenues from continuing operations were earned prior to June 30,&#13;2017 from its management services agreement with BRHC, which was cancelled by BRHC effective June 30, 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;recognizes management fee income as services are provided.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;recognized oil and gas revenues from its former interests in producing wells when production was delivered to, and title was transferred&#13;to, the purchaser and to the extent the selling price is reasonably determinable. Oil and gas revenues are reflected as a component&#13;of discontinued operations on the statements of operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Asset Retirement Obligations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;records the fair value of a liability for an asset retirement obligation in the period in which the well is spud or the asset&#13;is acquired and a corresponding increase in the carrying amount of the related long-lived asset. The liability is accreted to&#13;its present value each period, and the capitalized cost is depreciated over the useful life of the related asset. If the liability&#13;is settled for an amount other than the recorded amount, a gain or loss is recognized. The expense related to accretion of the&#13;discount on the asset retirement liability is reflected as component of discontinued operations on the statement of operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Full Cost Method&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;followed the full cost method of accounting for oil and gas operations in 2016 whereby all costs related to the exploration and&#13;development of oil and gas properties were initially capitalized into a single cost center (&amp;#34;full cost pool&amp;#34;). The Company&#13;had no oil and gas operations in 2017 as they were disposed as part of the debt restructuring transaction on June 21, 2016 described&#13;in Note 4 &amp;#8211; Debt Restructuring. Capitalized costs included land acquisition costs, geological and geophysical expenses,&#13;carrying charges on non-producing properties, costs of drilling directly related to acquisition, and exploration activities. Internal&#13;costs that were capitalized were directly attributable to acquisition, exploration and development activities and did not include&#13;costs related to general corporate overhead or similar activities. Costs associated with general corporate activities were expensed&#13;in the period incurred. Capitalized costs for year ended December, 2016 are summarized as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Year Ended&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;December 31, 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized Certain Payroll and Other Internal Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 83%; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized Interest Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,219&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-indent: 12.4pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,219&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Proceeds&#13;from sales of proved properties were credited to the full cost pool, with no gain or loss recognized, unless such a sale would&#13;significantly alter the relationship between capitalized costs and the proved reserves attributable to these costs. A significant&#13;alteration would typically involve a sale of 20% or more of the proved reserves related to a single full cost pool. The Company&#13;assessed all items classified as unevaluated property on a quarterly basis for possible impairment or reduction in value. The&#13;assessment included consideration of the following factors, among others: intent to drill; remaining lease term; geological and&#13;geophysical evaluations; drilling results and activity; the assignment of proved reserves; and the economic viability of development&#13;if proved reserves are assigned. During any period in which these factors indicate an impairment, the cumulative drilling costs&#13;incurred to date for such property and all or a portion of the associated leasehold costs were transferred to the full cost pool&#13;and were then subject to amortization.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized&#13;costs associated with impaired properties and properties having proved reserves, estimated future development costs, and asset&#13;retirement costs under FASB ASC 410-20-25 were depleted and amortized on the unit-of-production method based on the estimated&#13;gross proved reserves as determined by independent petroleum engineers. The costs of unproved properties were withheld from the&#13;depletion base until such time as they are either developed or abandoned.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized&#13;costs of oil and gas properties (net of related deferred income taxes) could not exceed an amount equal to the present value,&#13;discounted at 10% per annum, of the estimated future net cash flows from proved oil and gas reserves plus the cost of unproved&#13;properties (adjusted for related income tax effects). When capitalized costs exceeded this ceiling, impairment was recognized.&#13;The present value of estimated future net cash flows was computed by applying the arithmetic average first day price of oil and&#13;natural gas for the preceding twelve months to estimated future production of proved oil and gas reserves as of the end of the&#13;period, less estimated future expenditures to be incurred in developing and producing the proved reserves and assuming continuation&#13;of existing economic conditions. Such present value of proved reserves' future net cash flows excludes future cash outflows associated&#13;with settling asset retirement obligations. When this comparison indicated an excess carrying value, the excess was charged to&#13;earnings as an impairment expense. The Company recognized an impairment loss of $5,219,000 during the year ended December 31,&#13;2016. The impairment loss is reflected as a component of discontinued operations on the statement of operations for the period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basic&#13;and Diluted Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Basic earnings&#13;(loss) per share (&amp;#8220;EPS&amp;#8221;) are computed by dividing net income (the numerator) by the weighted average number of common&#13;shares outstanding for the period (the denominator). Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted average number&#13;of common shares and potential common shares outstanding (if dilutive) during each period. Potential common shares include stock&#13;options, warrants and restricted stock. The number of potential common shares outstanding relating to stock options, warrants&#13;and restricted stock is computed using the treasury stock method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The reconciliation&#13;of the denominators used to calculate basic EPS and diluted EPS for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and 2016 are as&#13;follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=6 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Years Ended December&#13;    31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 66%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Weighted average common shares outstanding &amp;#8211;&#13;    basic&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;160,970,732&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;47,979,990&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Plus: Potentially dilutive common shares:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-indent: 13.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Stock options and warrants&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Weighted average common shares outstanding&#13;    &amp;#8211; diluted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;160,970,732&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;49,979,990&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;For 2017&#13;and 2016, potential dilutive securities had an anti-dilutive effect and were not included in the calculation of diluted net loss&#13;per common share. Stock options and warrants excluded from the calculation of diluted EPS because their effect was anti-dilutive&#13;were 11,292,300 and 10,957,000 of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and 2016, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-Based&#13;Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Under FASB&#13;ASC 718-10-30-2, all share-based payments to employees, including grants of employee stock options, are to be recognized in the&#13;income statement based on their fair values. Pro forma disclosure is no longer an alternative. Amortization of the fair values&#13;of stock options issued for services and compensation totaled $574,851 and $626,602 for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017&#13;and&amp;#160;2016, respectively. The fair values of stock options were determined using the Black-Scholes options pricing model and&#13;an effective term of 6 to 6.5 years based on the weighted average of the vesting periods and the stated term of the option grants&#13;and the discount rate on 5 to 7 year U.S. Treasury securities at the grant date and are being amortized over the related implied&#13;service term, or vesting period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Uncertain Tax Positions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In accordance&#13;with ASC 740, &amp;#8220;Income Taxes&amp;#8221; (&amp;#8220;ASC 740&amp;#8221;), the Company recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain tax&#13;position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be capable of withstanding examination by the taxing authorities&#13;based on the technical merits of the position. These standards prescribe a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for&#13;the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. These standards&#13;also provide guidance on de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure, and&#13;transition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Various taxing&#13;authorities can periodically audit the Company&amp;#8217;s income tax returns. These audits include questions regarding the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;tax filing positions, including the timing and amount of deductions and the allocation of income to various tax jurisdictions.&#13;In evaluating the exposures connected with these various tax filing positions, including state and local taxes, the Company records&#13;allowances for probable exposures. A number of years may elapse before a particular matter, for which an allowance has been established,&#13;is audited and fully resolved. The Company has not yet undergone an examination by any taxing authorities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The assessment&#13;of the Company&amp;#8217;s tax position relies on the judgment of management to estimate the exposures associated with the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;various filing positions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt/normal Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent&#13;Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;From&#13;time to time, new accounting pronouncements are issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#34;FASB&amp;#34;) that are&#13;adopted by the Company as of the specified effective date. If not discussed, management believes that the impact of recently issued&#13;standards, which are not yet effective, will not have a material impact on the Company's financial statements upon adoption.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In December&#13;2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-20, &lt;i&gt;Technical Corrections and Improvements to Topic 606, Revenue from Contracts with Customers&lt;/i&gt;.&#13;This guidance updates narrow aspects of the guidance issued in Update 2014-09. This amendment is effective for periods after December&#13;15, 2017, with early adoption permitted. The Company adopted this standard on January 1, 2018 and anticipates it will not have&#13;a material impact on its financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In August,&#13;2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) No. 2016-15, &lt;i&gt;Statement of Cash Flows (Topic 230): Classification of&#13;Certain Cash Receipts and Cash Payments &lt;/i&gt;(a consensus of the Emerging Issues Task Force). &lt;font style=color: black&gt;This guidance&#13;provides guidance of eight specific cash flow issues. This amendment is effective for periods beginning after December 15, 2017,&#13;with early adoption permitted. The Company adopted this standard on January 1, 2018 and anticipates it will not have a material&#13;impact on its financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basis&#13;of Accounting&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Principles&#13;of Consolidation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The accompanying&#13;consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the following entities:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 69%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Name&#13;    of entity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 2%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 13%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;State&#13;    of Incorporation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 2%; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 14%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Relationship&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Black Ridge Oil and Gas, Inc.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Nevada&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Parent&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Black Ridge Acquisition Corp. (&amp;#8220;BRAC&amp;#8221;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Delaware&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Subsidiary&lt;sup&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;sup&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;sup&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;Wholly-owned&#13;subsidiary through October 10, 2017, the date of BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO, following which it is consolidated as a variable interest entity.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;has determined that BRAC, following its IPO, is a variable interest entity (&amp;#8220;VIE&amp;#8221;) and that the Company is the primary&#13;beneficiary of the VIE. The Company determined that, due to the redemption feature associated with the IPO shares, that the IPO&#13;shareholders are indirectly protected from the operating expenses of BRAC and it has the power to direct the activities of BRAC&#13;through the date at which BRAC affords the stockholders the opportunity to vote to approve a proposed business combination. Therefore,&#13;these consolidated financial statements herein contain the operations of the BRAC from its inception on May 9, 2017. BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;IPO shareholders are reflected in our Consolidated Financial Statements as a non-controlling interest. The non-controlling interest&#13;was recorded at fair value on October 10, 2017, with an addition on October 18, 2017 as a result of the underwriters&amp;#8217; exercise&#13;of their over-allotment option. All significant inter-company transactions have been eliminated in the preparation of theses financial&#13;statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; border-collapse: collapse&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 69%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Name&#13;    of entity&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; width: 2%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 13%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;State&#13;    of Incorporation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 2%; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; width: 14%; border-bottom: black 1pt solid; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Relationship&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: rgb(204

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Black Ridge Oil and Gas, Inc.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Nevada&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Parent&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Black Ridge Acquisition Corp. (&amp;#8220;BRAC&amp;#8221;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Delaware&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Subsidiary&lt;sup&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Environmental&#13;Liabilities&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash and Cash Equivalents&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Restricted&#13;cash and securities held in Trust Account&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Cash in Excess of FDIC Insured&#13;Limits&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; font-weight: normal&gt;&lt;u&gt;Debt&#13;Issuance Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Website Development Costs&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;accounts for website development costs in accordance with ASC 350-50, &amp;#8220;Accounting for Website Development Costs&amp;#8221; (&amp;#8220;ASC&#13;350-50&amp;#8221;), wherein website development costs are segregated into three activities:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.5in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Initial&#13;                                         stage (planning), whereby the related costs are expensed.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.5in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Development&#13;                                         (web application, infrastructure, graphics), whereby the related costs are capitalized&#13;                                         and amortized once the website is ready for use. Costs for development content of the&#13;                                         website may be expensed or capitalized depending on the circumstances of the expenditures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt&gt;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: top&gt;&#13;&lt;td style=width: 0.5in&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 0.25in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Post-implementation&#13;                                         (after site is up and running: security, training, admin), whereby the related costs&#13;                                         are expensed as incurred. Upgrades are usually expensed, unless they add additional functionality.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;recognizes deferred tax assets and liabilities based on differences between the financial reporting and tax basis of assets and&#13;liabilities using the enacted tax rates and laws that are expected to be in effect when the differences are expected to be recovered.&#13;The Company provides a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets for which it does not consider realization of such assets to&#13;be more likely than not.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Fair Value&#13;of Financial Instruments&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Property&#13;and Equipment&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Concentration&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;recognizes management fee income as services are provided.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Asset Retirement Obligations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Full Cost Method&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;followed the full cost method of accounting for oil and gas operations in 2016 whereby all costs related to the exploration and&#13;development of oil and gas properties were initially capitalized into a single cost center (&amp;#34;full cost pool&amp;#34;). The Company&#13;had no oil and gas operations in 2017 as they were disposed as part of the debt restructuring transaction on June 21, 2016 described&#13;in Note 4 &amp;#8211; Debt Restructuring. Capitalized costs included land acquisition costs, geological and geophysical expenses,&#13;carrying charges on non-producing properties, costs of drilling directly related to acquisition, and exploration activities. Internal&#13;costs that were capitalized were directly attributable to acquisition, exploration and development activities and did not include&#13;costs related to general corporate overhead or similar activities. Costs associated with general corporate activities were expensed&#13;in the period incurred. Capitalized costs for year ended December, 2016 are summarized as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Year Ended&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;December 31, 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized Certain Payroll and Other Internal Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 83%; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized Interest Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,219&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-indent: 12.4pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,219&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Proceeds&#13;from sales of proved properties were credited to the full cost pool, with no gain or loss recognized, unless such a sale would&#13;significantly alter the relationship between capitalized costs and the proved reserves attributable to these costs. A significant&#13;alteration would typically involve a sale of 20% or more of the proved reserves related to a single full cost pool. The Company&#13;assessed all items classified as unevaluated property on a quarterly basis for possible impairment or reduction in value. The&#13;assessment included consideration of the following factors, among others: intent to drill; remaining lease term; geological and&#13;geophysical evaluations; drilling results and activity; the assignment of proved reserves; and the economic viability of development&#13;if proved reserves are assigned. During any period in which these factors indicate an impairment, the cumulative drilling costs&#13;incurred to date for such property and all or a portion of the associated leasehold costs were transferred to the full cost pool&#13;and were then subject to amortization.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized&#13;costs associated with impaired properties and properties having proved reserves, estimated future development costs, and asset&#13;retirement costs under FASB ASC 410-20-25 were depleted and amortized on the unit-of-production method based on the estimated&#13;gross proved reserves as determined by independent petroleum engineers. The costs of unproved properties were withheld from the&#13;depletion base until such time as they are either developed or abandoned.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Year Ended&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;December 31, 2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized Certain Payroll and Other Internal Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 83%; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Capitalized Interest Costs&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,219&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Basic&#13;and Diluted Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Basic earnings&#13;(loss) per share (&amp;#8220;EPS&amp;#8221;) are computed by dividing net income (the numerator) by the weighted average number of common&#13;shares outstanding for the period (the denominator). Diluted EPS is computed by dividing net income by the weighted average number&#13;of common shares and potential common shares outstanding (if dilutive) during each period. Potential common shares include stock&#13;options, warrants and restricted stock. The number of potential common shares outstanding relating to stock options, warrants&#13;and restricted stock is computed using the treasury stock method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The reconciliation&#13;of the denominators used to calculate basic EPS and diluted EPS for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and 2016 are as&#13;follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=6 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Years Ended December&#13;    31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 66%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Weighted average common shares outstanding &amp;#8211;&#13;    basic&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;160,970,732&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%;
