204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-indent: 20pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Total other income (expense)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(1,696,544&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Loss before provision for income taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(10,197,374&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-indent: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Provision for income taxes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
238
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Net income (loss)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(10,197,374&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;As described&#13;in Note 8, BRHC was dissolved in October of 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;IPO&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The registration&#13;statement for the BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO was declared effective on October 4, 2017. The registration statement was initially declared&#13;effective for 10,000,000 units (&amp;#8220;Units&amp;#8221; and, with respect to the common stock included in the Units being offered,&#13;the &amp;#8220;Public Shares&amp;#8221;), but the offering was increased to 12,000,000 Units pursuant to Rule 462(b) under the Securities&#13;Act of 1933, as amended. On October 10, 2017, the Company consummated the Initial Public Offering of 12,000,000 units, generating&#13;gross proceeds of $120,000,000.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Simultaneous&#13;with the closing of the Initial Public Offering, BRAC sold 400,000 units (the &amp;#8220;Placement Units&amp;#8221;) at a price of $10.00&#13;per Unit in a private placement to BROG, generating gross proceeds of $4,000,000. BROG&amp;#8217;s investment in BRAC&amp;#8217;s common&#13;stock is eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Transaction&#13;costs relating to the IPO amounted to $2,882,226, consisting of $2,400,000 of underwriting fees and $482,226 of other costs.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Following&#13;the closing of the IPO on October 10, 2017, an amount of $120,600,000 ($10.05 per Unit) from the net proceeds of the sale of the&#13;Units in the IPO and the Placement Units was placed in a trust account (&amp;#8220;Trust Account&amp;#8221;) and is invested in U.S. government&#13;securities, within the meaning set forth in Section 2(a)(16) of the Investment Company Act of 1940, as amended (the &amp;#8220;Investment&#13;Company Act&amp;#8221;), with a maturity of 180 days or less or in any open-ended investment company that holds itself out as a money&#13;market fund selected by the Company meeting the conditions of paragraphs (d)(2), (d)(3) and (d)(4) of Rule 2a-7 of the Investment&#13;Company Act, as determined by the Company, until the earlier of: (i) the consummation of a Business Combination or (ii) the distribution&#13;of the Trust Account, as described below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;On October&#13;18, 2017, in connection with the underwriters&amp;#8217; exercise of their over-allotment option in full, BRAC sold an additional&#13;1,800,000 Units and the sale of an additional 45,000 Placement Units to BROG at $10.00 per Unit, generating total proceeds of&#13;$18,450,000. Transaction costs for underwriting fees on the sale of the over-allotment units were $360,000. Following the closing,&#13;an additional $18,090,000 of the net proceeds ($10.05 per Unit) was placed in the Trust Account, bringing the total aggregate&#13;proceeds held in the Trust Account to $138,690,000 ($10.05 per Unit). BROG&amp;#8217;s investment in BRAC&amp;#8217;s common stock is&#13;eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; color: black&gt;BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;management has broad discretion with respect to the specific application of the net proceeds of the IPO and private placement,&#13;although substantially all of the net proceeds are intended to be applied generally toward consummating a Business Combination.&#13;There is no assurance that the BRAC will be able to complete a Business Combination successfully. Upon the closing of the IPO,&#13;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;10.05 &lt;font style=color: black&gt;per Unit sold in the IPO, including some of the proceeds&#13;of the Private Placements was deposited in a trust account (&amp;#8220;Trust Account&amp;#8221;) to be held until the earlier of (i) the&#13;consummation of its initial Business Combination or (ii) BRAC&amp;#8217;s failure to consummate a Business Combination within 21 months&#13;from the consummation of the IPO (the &amp;#8220;Combination Period&amp;#8221;). Placing funds in the Trust Account may not protect those&#13;funds from third party claims against BRAC. Although BRAC will seek to have all vendors, service providers, prospective target&#13;businesses or other entities it engages, execute agreements with BRAC waiving any claim of any kind in or to any monies held in&#13;the Trust Account, there is no guarantee that such persons will execute such agreements. The Trust Account is maintained by a&#13;third party trustee. The remaining net proceeds (not held in the Trust Account) may be used to pay for business, legal and accounting&#13;due diligence on prospective acquisitions and continuing general and administrative expenses. Additionally, the interest earned&#13;on the Trust Account balance may be released to BRAC for any amounts that are necessary to pay BRAC&amp;#8217;s income and other tax&#13;obligations and up to $50,000 that may be used to pay for the costs of liquidating BRAC. BROG has agreed that it will be liable&#13;to ensure that the proceeds in the Trust Account are not reduced below $10.05 per share by the claims of target businesses or&#13;claims of vendors or other entities that are owed money by BRAC for services rendered or contracted for or products sold to BRAC,&#13;but there is no assurance that BROG will be able to satisfy its indemnification obligations if it is required to do so. Additionally,&#13;the agreement entered into by BROG specifically provides for two exceptions to the indemnity it has given: it will have no liability&#13;(1) as to any claimed amounts owed to a target business or vendor or other entity who has executed an agreement with BRAC waiving&#13;any right, title, interest or claim of any kind they may have in or to any monies held in the Trust Account, or (2) as to any&#13;claims for indemnification by the underwriters of the IPO against certain liabilities, including liabilities under the Securities&#13;Act of 1933, as amended.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; color: black&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;Initial&#13;Business Combination&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Pursuant&#13;to the Nasdaq Capital Markets listing rules, BRAC&amp;#8217;s initial Business Combination must be with a target business or businesses&#13;whose collective fair market value is at least equal to 80% of the balance in the Trust Account at the time of the execution of&#13;a definitive agreement for such Business Combination, although this may entail simultaneous acquisitions of several target businesses.&#13;The fair market value of the target will be determined by BRAC&amp;#8217;s board of directors based upon one or more standards generally&#13;accepted by the financial community (such as actual and potential sales, earnings, cash flow and/or book value). The target business&#13;or businesses that BRAC acquires may have a collective fair market value substantially in excess of 80% of the Trust Account balance.&#13;In order to consummate such a Business Combination, BRAC may issue a significant amount of its debt or equity securities to the&#13;sellers of such business and/or seek to raise additional funds through a private offering of debt or equity securities. If BRAC&amp;#8217;s&#13;securities are not listed on NASDAQ after the IPO, BRAC would not be required to satisfy the 80% requirement. However, BRAC intends&#13;to satisfy the 80% requirement even if BRAC&amp;#8217;s securities are not listed on NASDAQ at the time of the initial Business Combination.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; color: black&gt;BRAC&#13;will provide the public stockholders, who are the holders of the common stock which was sold as part of the Units in the IPO,&#13;whether they are purchased in the IPO or in the aftermarket, or &amp;#8220;Public Shares&amp;#8221;, including BROG to the extent that&#13;it purchases such Public Shares (&amp;#8220;Public Stockholders&amp;#8221;), with an opportunity to redeem all or a portion of their Public&#13;Shares of BRAC&amp;#8217;s Common stock, irrespective of whether they vote for or against the proposed transaction or if BRAC conducts&#13;a tender offer, upon the completion of the initial Business Combination either (1) in connection with a stockholder meeting called&#13;to approve the Business Combination, or (ii) by means of a tender offer, at a per-share price, payable in cash, equal to the aggregate&#13;amount then on deposit in the Trust Account including interest (net of franchise and income taxes payable, divided by the number&#13;of then outstanding Public Shares. The amount in the Trust Account, net of franchise and income taxes payable, currently amounts&#13;to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$10.06 per &lt;font style=color: black&gt;Public Share. The common stock subject to redemption&#13;will be recorded at a redemption value and classified a temporary equity upon the completion of the IPO, in accordance with Accounting&#13;Standards Codification (&amp;#8220;ASC&amp;#8221;) Topic 480 &amp;#8220;Distinguishing Liabilities from Equity&amp;#8221;. BRAC will proceed with&#13;a Business Combination only if BRAC has net tangible assets of at &lt;/font&gt;least $5,000,001 &lt;font style=color: black&gt;upon such&#13;consummation of a Business Combination and in the case of a stockholder vote, a majority of the outstanding shares voted are voted&#13;in favor of the Business Combination. The decision as to whether BRAC will seek stockholder approval of a proposed Business Combination&#13;or conduct a tender offer will be made by BRAC, solely in its discretion, based on a variety of factors such as the timing of&#13;the transaction and whether the terms of the transaction would otherwise require it to seek stockholder approval under the law&#13;or stock exchange listing requirement. If a stockholder vote is not required and BRAC decides not to hold a stockholder vote for&#13;business or other legal reasons, BRAC will, pursuant to the proposed amended and restated certificate of incorporation, (i) conduct&#13;the redemptions pursuant to Rule 13e-4 and Regulation 14E of the Exchange Act, which regulate issuer tender offers, and (ii) file&#13;tender offer documents with the SEC prior to completing the initial Business Combination which contain substantially the same&#13;financial and other information about the initial Business Combination and the redemption rights as is required under Regulation&#13;14A of the Exchange Act, which regulates the solicitation of proxies.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; color: black&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; color: black&gt;BROG&#13;has agreed to vote its Founder Shares and any Public Shares purchased during or after the IPO in favor of the initial Business&#13;Combination, and BRAC&amp;#8217;s executive officers and directors have also agreed to vote any Public Shares purchased during or&#13;after the IPO in favor of the Initial Business &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Combination. BROG entered into a letter agreement,&#13;pursuant to which it agreed to waive its redemption rights with respect to the Founder Shares, shares included in the Placement&#13;Units and Public Shares in connection with the completion of the initial Business Combination. In addition, BROG has agreed to&#13;waive its rights to liquidating distributions from the Trust Account with respect to the Founder Shares and shares included in&#13;the Placement Units if BRAC fails to complete the initial Business Combination within the prescribed time frame. However, if BROG&#13;(or any of BRAC&amp;#8217;s executive officers, directors or affiliates) acquires Public Shares in or after the IPO, it will be entitled&#13;to liquidating distributions from the Trust Account with respect to such Public Shares in the event BRAC does not complete the&#13;initial Business Combination within such applicable time period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;Failure&#13;to Consummate a Business Combination&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;If BRAC is&#13;unable to complete the initial Business Combination within the Combination Period, BRAC must: (i) cease all operations except&#13;for the purpose of winding up, (ii) as promptly as reasonably possible but not more than ten business days thereafter, redeem&#13;the public shares, at a per-share price, payable in cash, equal to the aggregate amount then on deposit in the Trust Account,&#13;including interest (which interest shall be net of franchise and income taxes payable divided by the number of then outstanding&#13;Public Shares, which redemption will completely extinguish Public Stockholders&amp;#8217; rights as stockholders (including the right&#13;to receive further liquidation distributions, if any), subject to applicable law, and (iii) as promptly as reasonably possible&#13;following such redemption, subject to the approval of BRAC&amp;#8217;s remaining stockholders and BRAC&amp;#8217;s Board of Directors,&#13;dissolve and liquidate, subject in the case of clauses (ii) and (iii) to BRAC&amp;#8217;s obligations under Delaware law to provide&#13;for claims of creditors and the requirements of other applicable law.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;Consolidation&#13;of BRAC and Non-controlling Interest&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;has determined that BRAC, following its IPO, is a variable interest entity (&amp;#8220;VIE&amp;#8221;) and that the Company is the primary&#13;beneficiary of the VIE. The Company determined that, due to the redemption feature associated with the IPO shares, that the IPO&#13;shareholders are indirectly protected from the operating expenses of BRAC and BROG has the power to direct the activities of BRAC&#13;through the date at which BRAC affords the stockholders the opportunity to vote to approve a proposed business combination. Therefore,&#13;these consolidated financial statements contain the operations of the BRAC from its inception on May 9, 2017. BRAC&amp;#8217;s IPO&#13;shareholders are reflected in our Consolidated Financial Statements as a redeemable non-controlling interest. The non-controlling&#13;interest was recorded at fair value on October 10, 2017, with an addition on October 18, 2017 as a result of the underwriters&amp;#8217;&#13;exercise of their over-allotment option. The net earnings attributable to the IPO shareholders are subtracted from the net loss&#13;for the year ended December 31, 2017 to arrive at the net loss attributable to the Company and the non-controlling interest on&#13;the balance sheet was adjusted to include the net earnings attributable to the IPO shareholders.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;Intercompany&#13;transactions and eliminations&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;BROG is paid&#13;a management fee by BRAC of $10,000 per month as part of an administrative services agreement, which commenced October 5, 2017,&#13;for general and administrative services including the cost of office space and personnel dedicated to BRAC. BROG is reimbursed&#13;for any out-of-pocket expenses, particularly travel, incurred in connection with activities on BRAC&amp;#8217;s behalf, including&#13;but not limited to identifying potential target businesses and performing due diligence on suitable business combinations. There&#13;is no cap or ceiling on the reimbursement of out-of-pocket expenses incurred by BRAC. BRAC paid a total of $28,710 to BROG for&#13;such services during the year ended December 31, 2017. The management services income of BROG and the management services expense&#13;of BRAC as well as any balances due between the companies for such services or reimbursements were eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;December 31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;December 31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(40.0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; 238
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;We account&#13;for income taxes under the provisions of ASC Topic 740, &lt;i&gt;Income taxes, &lt;/i&gt;which provides for an asset and liability approach&#13;for income taxes. Under this approach, deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized based on anticipated future tax consequences,&#13;using currently enacted tax laws, attributable to temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities&#13;for financial reporting purposes and the amounts calculated for income tax purposes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&#13;will not consolidate income tax returns for BROG and BRAC. For the year ended December 31, 2017 the impact of both returns are&#13;combined in the presentation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Our provision&#13;for income taxes for the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and&amp;#160;2016 consisted of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman

   &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;1392.7%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;0.0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; 204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Net effective income tax rate&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;0.0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;41.8%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(46.1%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;0.0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The 2017&#13;combined reconciliation above is a weighted average of the two separate taxable entities. As one entity has a loss and the other&#13;has income, the weighted average produces results that are skewed higher or lower than the individual components, as such we have&#13;presented the individual entity reconciliations. BROG&amp;#8217;s state income tax rate as of December 31, 2017 increased by 0.3%&#13;from 3.3% as of December 31, 2016, to 3.6%. This increase in the effective tax rate is attributable to changes in the Company&amp;#8217;s&#13;state apportionment factors in the current year. BRAC&amp;#8217;s state income tax rate was 6.8% due as all of its income and expenses&#13;were from Minnesota, which has a higher tax rate.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The components&#13;of the deferred tax assets and liabilities as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017 and 2016 are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Net deferred tax assets (liabilities)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;8,712,615&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;11,788,566&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-indent: 13.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Less: valuation allowance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(8,693,937&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(11,788,566&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Deferred tax assets (liabilities)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;18,678&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#8211;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;As of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2017,&#13;BROG has a net operating loss carryover of approximately $26,449,110. Under existing Federal law, the net operating loss may be&#13;utilized to offset taxable income through the year ended December&amp;#160;31, 2035. A portion of the net operating loss carryover&#13;begins to expire in 2030.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;ASC Topic&#13;740 provides that a valuation allowance is recognized if, based on the weight of available evidence, it is more likely than not&#13;that some portion or all of the deferred tax asset will not be realized. In 2017, BROG decreased its valuation allowance from&#13;$11,788,566 to $8,693,937 to adjust for the decrease in net deferred tax assets primarily due to the reduction in the federal&#13;tax rate to 21% in 2018. The Company believes it is more likely than not that the benefit of these remaining assets will not be&#13;realized by BROG. The Company did not place a valuation allowance on deferred tax asset for BRAC related to the unrealized loss&#13;on marketable securities held in trust account. The Company believes it is more likely than not that the benefit of these remaining&#13;assets will be realized by BRAC.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The&#13;Company files annual US Federal income tax returns and annual income tax returns for the states of Minnesota, North Dakota and&#13;Montana. We are not subject to income tax examinations by tax authorities for years before 2013 for all returns. Income taxing&#13;authorities have conducted no formal examinations of our past federal or state income tax returns and supporting records.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0pt 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Unrealized marketable equity securities held in trust account&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; /**
 * Rivet Software Inc.
 *
 * @copyright Copyright (c) 2006-2011 Rivet Software
 Inc. All rights reserved.
 * Version 2.4.0.3
 *
 */
var Show = {};
Show.LastAR = null
Show.hideAR = function(){
	Show.LastAR.style.display = 'none';
};
Show.showAR = function ( link
 id
 win ){
	if( Show.LastAR ){
		Show.hideAR();
	}
	var ref = link;
	do {
		ref = ref.nextSibling;
	} while (ref && ref.nodeName != 'TABLE');
	if (!ref || ref.nodeName != 'TABLE') {
		var tmp = win ?
			win.document.getElementById(id) :
			document.getElementById(id);
		if( tmp ){
			ref = tmp.cloneNode(true);
			ref.id = '';
			link.parentNode.appendChild(ref);
		}
	}
	if( ref ){
		ref.style.display = 'block';
		Show.LastAR = ref;
	}
};
Show.toggleNext = function( link ){
	var ref = link;
	do{
		ref = ref.nextSibling;
	}while( ref.nodeName != 'DIV' );
	if( ref.style &&
		ref.style.display &&
		ref.style.display == 'none' ){
		ref.style.display = 'block';
		if( link.textContent ){
			link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '+'
 '-' );
		}else{
			link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '+'
 '-' );
		}
	}else{
		ref.style.display = 'none';
		if( link.textContent ){
			link.textContent = link.textContent.replace( '-'
 '+' );
		}else{
			link.innerText = link.innerText.replace( '-'
 '+' );
		}
	}
};








/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */
/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}
..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}
..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}
..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}
..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}
/* Report Styles */
..pl a
 .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}
/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica
 Arial
 san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}
..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}
/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}
..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica
 Arial
 san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}
..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}
..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}
..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}
..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}
/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}
/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}
/* Even rows... */
..report .re
 .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}
..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro
 .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}
..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}
..report .rou table td
 .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}
/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}
/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num
 .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}
..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}
..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}
/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}
..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}
..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}
..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}
..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}
..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}
..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
